overview: Through a course of research, students undertake their year-long project in Interactive Composition under the guidance of their individual supervisor for presentation at the end of the academic year.
The major project can consist of single defined project and/or contributions to a number of projects depending on the nature of the discipline.

At the time of selection the written outline of the proposed major project or major field of study is submitted. This provides the framework for developing the lines of inquiry taken by the student and the final creative work outcome.

assessments.description: A creative work major project to the equivalent of a dissertation (Please see below). 15000 words (equivalent)
assessments.timing: At the end of the academic year in the assessment period

Year Long.Contact hours: Seminars and contact with mentors and supervisors as appropriate.

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.

Related Handbook entries: This subject contributes to the following:
Available to Study Abroad and/or Study E: This subject is available to students studying at the University from eligible overseas institutions on exchange and study abroad. Students are required to satisfy any listed requirements, such as pre- and co-requisites, for enrolment in the subject.
